caseTitle: Abdullah Nawaz Cheema v. Federal Public Service Commission (FPSC), Islamabad & another
tagline: Where a female candidate secures sufficient merit to be allocated a group on the Open Merit, she may opt for a better group, if that is available in the Women Quota. Once she has opted for a better group, the one she had previously been allocated in Open Merit will be left vacant. This vacant group seat is then transferred to the Women Quota which was short a seat when the candidate had opted for the then available better seat. This allows for there to be a constant number of reserved seats in the Women Quota without depriving deserving Female Candidates, higher on the merit list, better group seats.
